Next, a horizontal translation: shift the point one unit to the left. That subtracts one from the x coordinate. Negative one becomes negative two; the y value remains negative two.
Now reflect across the x axis. This time the y value changes sign while x stays fixed. So negative two, negative two becomes negative two, positive two.

Now, the problem. We are given g of x equals negative f of minus x minus one, plus three, and the point one, negative two lies on the graph of f. We will find its image under g.
Let us move to the coordinate plane and track the image step by step.
We begin at the point one, negative two on f.
First, reflect across the y axis. The x coordinate changes sign; y is unchanged.
Next, translate one unit to the left. Only the x coordinate decreases by one.
Now, reflect across the x axis. The y coordinate changes sign; x is unchanged.
Finally, translate upward by three units. Only the y coordinate increases by three.
Collecting all steps, the resulting point is negative two, five.
